questions.question: Which definition most accurately describes human nature?

choices.answer: How you would act without being taught.
World without government or laws.
Agreement between people and their government.
Chicago Cubs

questions.question: Which definition most accurately describes the state of nature

choices.answer: How people would act without being taught.
A world without government or laws.
An agreement between people and their government.
Chicago Cubs

questions.question: Which definition most accurately describes the social contract?

choices.answer: How people would act without being taught.
A world without government or laws.
Agreement between people and their government.
Chicago Cubs

questions.question: Which of the following does each philosopher agree with?

choices.answer: Kings and Queens were placed in power by God.
All people are born equal.
A world without government is most ideal.
All resource should be shared by a community.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a part of Hobbes' description of human nature?

choices.answer: Equal
Morally Good
Selfish
Reasonable

questions.question: Which description best describes Hobbes' view of the state of nature?

choices.answer: Chaotic
It depends on how much food and shelter people have.
Peaceful
The state of nature is based upon the total population.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an aspect of the social contract according to Hobbes?

choices.answer: One Leader
Give up being selfish
Multiple leaders
Absolute power for whoever is in charge

questions.question: What is the purpose of government according to Hobbes?

choices.answer: Give everyone a chance to participate.
Protect the rights of white men.
Make sure everyone has enough of what they need.
Enforce the laws.
